title: The Computer Centre
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Teaching - Aids and devices
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Management - Study and teaching
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Employees - Training of
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Computer based information systems
abstract: Made by the Commonwealth Film Unit in 1972, this short film illustrates how an older staff member struggles with the introduction of new technology.
description: Episode of Series "Adults Learning". A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the apprehension adults feel in adapting to computer technology. Shows a group of trainees being taught the operation of punch cards as part of a session in the use of computers.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002913; 100 Years of Film Australia; Active; 2013
